node.title: One of Indonesia's largest volcanoes erupts leaving towns covered in dust
node.alt: A volcano erupts and spews ash into the sky
node.description: One of Indonesia's largest volcanoes erupts and spews thick columns ofÂ ash into the sky, leaving surrounding towns and villages covered in volcanic dust.
node.content: ["The highest volcano on Indonesia's most densely populated island of Java has spewed thick columns of ash\u00a0into the sky, triggering panic among people living nearby.", "There were no immediate reports of casualties.", "Mount Semeru's sudden eruption left several villages around its slopes blanketed with falling ash.", "The eruption was accompanied by a thunderstorm and rain, which pushed lava and smouldering debris and formed thick mud that destroyed at least one bridge connecting two main villages of Pronojiwo and Candipuro.\u00a0", "It also\u00a0hampered\u00a0the evacuation, Lumajang district head Thoriqul Haq told local media.", "\"Thick columns of ash have turned several villages to darkness,\" Mr Haq said,", "He added\u00a0that several hundred people were moved to temporary shelters, or left for safer areas.", "Television reports showed people running in panic under a huge ash cloud, their faces wet from rain mixed with volcanic dust.", "The 3,676-metre Semeru\u00a0last erupted in January, with no casualties.", "Indonesia, an archipelago of more than 270 million people, is prone to earthquakes and volcanic activity because it sits along the Pacific Ring of Fire,\u00a0a horseshoe-shaped series of fault lines.", "AP"]
